intro.p:
Consider the invertible function given below.
f(x) = {{c}} \left( {{farg}} \right)^{ {{b}} }

content.p: Write out (in words!) a sequence of steps to describe what the function f does to an input x.
For example, Step1 could be: "add the number {{a}} to x".

item.p: Step2. Raise the result of Step1 to the power of {{b}}.
Step3. Multiply the result of Step2 by the number {{c}} .

content.p: Reverse (aka invert) your steps from the previous task to write down a sequence of steps (in words!) which describes what the inverse function f^{-1}(x) does to an input x.
Then use your inverted steps to write an equation for the inverse function.

item.p: Step2. Raise the result of Step1 to the power of {{b1}}.
Step3. Subtract {{a}} from the result of Step2.

outtro.p:
The corresponding inverse function is
f^{-1}(x) = \left( {{f1arg}} \right)^{ {{b1}} } {{sign1}} {{a1}}
